page.title: 042059 CARSEWELL FARM.
page.content: This is a pleasant country area comprising mainly of{FARMLAND}and{ {WOODS. WOODLAND_}There are 4 deciduous and 3 conifer woods covering approx. 97.5 acres.{FARMLAND_}There are 3 complete fields and parts of 10 others making a total of approx. 127.5 acres. {RIVERS_}2 Burns run through this area. 1_ An unpolluted spring which runs into the Silver Burn.2_ The Braidwood Burn, also unpolluted, is a tributary of the North Esk River.{ROADS_}The A766, a Main Road, runs N.W. from Penicuik to meet the A702 Trunk Road which links Edinburgh with the South. 1 unclassified road joins the A766 to the A702. 1 track leads to a disused mine, where there are now 2 derelict brick buildings and a rubbish dump.{ {HOUSES_}There are only 2 houses, each with a lovely garden.1_ A Stone Villa, 2 _ A Brick-built, harled Bungalow.
